text:
In a foreign currency quotation we have the price of one currency in units of another
currency. These are often referred to as the base currency and the price currency. In
the quotation 1.25 USD/EUR, the USD is the price currency and the EUR is the base
currency. The price of one euro (base currency) is 1.25 USD (the price currency) so
1.25 is the price of one unit of the base currency in terms of the other. It may help to
remember that the euro in this example is in the bottom or “base” of the exchange rate
given in terms of USD/EUR.
